intro: Acmena inophylla, commonly known as the silky acmena, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia, where it typically grows in rainforest or moist woodland habitats. The plant is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, round seeds.
